SENT.plain: Cytogenetic studies were carried out on the blood/bone marrow samples of three patients with chronic granulocytic leukaemia (CGL) and one patient with Burkitt's lymphoma
The karyotypes determined were 46, XY, Ph+ for patient O
A. and 46, XX, t(9q+, 22q) for patient E
L. with Burkitt's lymphoma presented two karyotypes: 46, XY and 46, XY, +18
The results showed that Philadelphia (Ph1) chromosome was detected in all the patients with CGL and a chromosome marker for African Burkitt's lymphoma in the boy with the disease
